thread.title: Trump to news media: 'I call my own shots'

title: Trump to news media: 'I call my own shots'

organizations.name: trump era means for financial markets the wall street journal
capitol hill fox news can trump

text:
Trump to news media: 'I call my own shots' CNBC 1 hr ago Berkeley Lovelace Jr. Click to expand Replay Video Senate Democrats to hold floor to protest DeVos nomination Chief congressional correspondent Mike Emanuel reports from Capitol Hill FOX News Can Trump win the war on poverty? Many citizens of Beattyville, Kentucky, are looking to President Donald Trump to turn around their financial troubles. CNN's Poppy Harlow reports. CNN Next steps in the Trump travel ban fight Lawyers for the federal government and states challenging President Trump's executive order are filing briefs at the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals in San Francisco. CBS News legal analyst Rikki Klieman joins "CBS This Morning" to discuss what's at stake. CBS News SETTINGS OFF HD HQ SD LO Trump to news media: 'I call my own shots' CNBC See more videos SHARE SHARE TWEET SHARE EMAIL What to watch next Senate Democrats to hold floor to protest DeVos nomination FOX News 2:13 Can Trump win the war on poverty? CNN 10:01 Next steps in the Trump travel ban fight CBS News 4:02 UK Speaker John Bercow Opposes Trump Addressing MPs Time 0:27 Yemeni Brothers Reunite With Family at Dulles Associated Press 2:27 Senator: SCOTUS nominee is far extreme right CNN 1:17 Criminals skip the chips for online account takeovers CBS News 3:33 Meteor lights up morning sky in Wisconsin WISN Milwaukee 1:01 NY jogger murder suspect arraigned CBS New York 1:38 See New York subway riders team up to erase offensive Nazi graffiti TODAY 0:43 Thai police charge boyfriend of Australian tourist killed in jet ski accident Reuters 0:45 Watch high school basketball team give final shot to student with special needs TODAY 0:45 Afghan diplomat shot dead at consulate in Pakistan Reuters 0:45 6-Year-Old Boy Sets Up Toy Giveaway Outside Home For Kids Who Don't Have Any Inside Edition 1:00 Many dead in Honduras bus crash Reuters 0:45 What the Trump Era Means for Financial Markets The Wall Street Journal. 1:45 UP NEXT President Donald Trump took another shot at the mainstream media on Monday, slamming coverage of the administration's temporary ban on refugees and of his leadership.
Trump, a frequent critic of the news media, tweeted on Monday that any negative polls regarding border security and "extreme vetting" of immigrants are "fake news."
Any negative polls are fake news, just like the CNN, ABC, NBC polls in the election. Sorry, people want border security and extreme vetting.
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 6, 2017
Minutes later, Trump fired off another tweet, saying as president he calls his "own shots."
I call my own shots, largely based on an accumulation of data, and everyone knows it. Some FAKE NEWS media, in order to marginalize, lies!
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 6, 2017
On Friday, a CNN/ORC poll found most Americans opposed the travel restrictions that were put in place by Trump's temporary immigration restrictions on refugees.
A U.S. appeals court late Saturday denied a request from the Justice Department to immediately restore Trump's order barring citizens from seven mainly Muslim countries and temporarily banning refugees.
Trump denounced the "so-called" judge in a series of tweets on Saturday.
On Sunday, The New York Times — one of Trump's biggest targets — published a story detailing the first two weeks of Trump's administration, including Trump signing an order giving chief strategist Steve Bannon a spot on the National Security Council. The report said Trump was not fully briefed on the details of the order.
